Posts.Content: Hi Tessa, Thanks for that don't worry I have all my fingers and toes crossed so that it will come back non-malignant that would just be the best. I am at work today and all of the office are Pinking the who;le building in advance because we are holding a Pink Friday on 30th October in support of Breast Cancer (ironically I sorted this out before I found my lump) but we are going all out now. I didn't think I would be able to make it into work this week cos I felt so awful Mon and Tues but the shock is easing and the encouragement received from this site has been unbelievable so it one day at a time. Take care Love  Terri xx
Posts.Title: breast lump and scared

Posts.Content: New to site today. Found a lump 2 weeks ago, mammogram yesterday and biopsy on 1cm lump today, have to wait till Monday for definate diagnosis but the gut who did the biopsy ruled out cyst and said whatever it is it needs to come out. I am new here and terrified, cant sleep feel sick and dizzy all the time and dont know how I sould be behaving........any suggestions please

Posts.Content: Hi Purdey, Thanks for that very positive reply. I have been looking on this site and am I right in thinking that because its 1cm then iits classed as stage 1. Both cconsultant and guy doing biopsy checked under my arms and said that was clear, sorry if this is not making much sense but my head is all over the place at the moment.   Take care Love Terri xxx

Posts.Content: Hi Di,   Thanks for your encouragement, everyone is so positive on this site what a welcome, things dont look quite so dire at the moment. Can you tell me did you have to have a general or local for the removal. I see consultant on Monday and dont really know what to expect Take care love Terri xx

Posts.Content: Hi Helen,   Please forgive my ignorance, this is all so far removed from my everyday life...till now,  is lumpectomy removal of the lump and what is full node clearance, sorry for sounding stupid please do not be offended. Like you my reasons are my two daaughters 16 and 15 and my beautiful 3 yr old son, thats what is breaking my heart at the moment. take care love terri xx

Posts.Title: breast lump and scared

Posts.Content: Hi Judith, Welcome to the club no one wants to join, there is fantastic support on here, you can rant and rave as much as you like and all of those questions that run around inside your head that you are too scared to voice can be voiced on here and 9 times out of 10 there is someone here with the answers. I was diagnosed on 5th Oct and like you the bottom fell out of my world, I have 3 children, two girls 15 and 16 and a 3 and a half year old son, like you I though this was it, who would look after my kids. I had a  lumpectomy and node clearance on 7th Oct and then was advised to have a mastectomy as they did not have a clear margin and there was 1 node affected out of 9 removed. I have had my mastectomy on 4th Nov. Like others have already said its not as bad as you think and the staff are fantastic, when the results came back last week they said it was the right choice as more cells were found in the remaining tissue. It took me a while to be able to look at the scar but when I did it wasnt as bad as I thought it would be. I am now waiting for an appointment with the oncologist to find out when chemo will start but the waiting is worse than the results so try not to get too stressed out (easier said than don I know). I have added you as friend so if I can be of any further help just shout. take care love Terri xxx
Posts.Title: new
